2023-04-22.name: Free Entrance Day at Minnesota state parks
2023-04-22.summary: Entrance to all 75 Minnesota state parks and recreation areas is free today.

2023-04-22.name: Minneapolis/St. Paul International Film Festival
2023-04-22.summary: More than 250 films from more than 70 countries will be shown, based at the five screens of St. Anthony Main, across the river from downtown.

2023-04-22.name: Milwaukee Film Festival
2023-04-22.summary: Watch more than 200 films from around the globe, based at the 1927 Oriental Theatre on the East Side.

2023-04-22.name: Grant's Home Front Reenactment
2023-04-22.summary: In Ulysses S. Grant's hometown, living-history reenacters hold an encampment along the river and stage Civil War battle reenactments at 11:30 a.m. Saturday and 1:30 p.m. Sunday.

2023-04-22.name: Eau Claire Jazz Festival
2023-04-22.summary: Headliners play the State Theatre, and on Friday, more than 50 bands play acoustic jazz, ragtime, big-band and blues along Barstow Street downtown, recreating New York's 52nd Street.

2023-04-22.name: Between the Bluffs Beer, Wine and Cheese Festival
2023-04-22.summary: Sample cheese and more than 200 beers and 45 wines at the Oktoberfest grounds.

2023-04-22.name: Bluegrass, Bourbon & Brews Festival
2023-04-22.summary: Hear music at half a dozen venues in the downtown of this western Wisconsin college town.

2023-04-01.name: Maple-syrup festivals
2023-04-01.summary: At nature centers around the region, tour the sugarbush and learn how to tap trees and boil sap. Then, eat a pancake breakfast with real maple syrup.

2023-04-01.name: International Festival
2023-04-01.summary: Dancers, musicians, storytellers and puppeteers representing traditions from around the world converge on the Overture Center for the Arts on State Street for this free festival.

2023-04-01.name: Maple Syrup Fest
2023-04-01.summary: In the northeast corner of Wisconsin, tour the sugarbush, tap trees,  make maple taffy in the snow and shop at an arts and crafts fair.

2023-04-02.name: Maple-syrup festivals
2023-04-02.summary: At nature centers around the region, tour the sugarbush and learn how to tap trees and boil sap. Then, eat a pancake breakfast with real maple syrup.

2023-04-02.name: International Festival
2023-04-02.summary: Dancers, musicians, storytellers and puppeteers representing traditions from around the world converge on the Overture Center for the Arts on State Street for this free festival.

2023-04-08.name: Eggstravaganza
2023-04-08.summary: At the Racine Zoo, the all-day Eggstravaganza includes a candy hunt, bounce houses, an egg dig, a dance party, egg- and cookie-decorating, crafts and games. Included with admission.

2023-04-08.name: Easter at the Castle
2023-04-08.summary: The American Swedish Institute hosts morning and afternoon Easter egg hunts at the 33-room Turnblad Mansion. There will also be crafts, storytelling and Easter tree-decorating. Register by March 24.

2023-04-08.name: Mission Creek Festival
2023-04-08.summary: Dozens of musicians, artists and writers perform and read at downtown venues. On Friday evening, there's a literature crawl.

2023-04-08.name: Egg Day
2023-04-08.summary: At the Milwaukee County Zoo, there will be an Easter parade, crafts and, of course, animals.

2023-04-13.name: Minneapolis/St. Paul International Film Festival
2023-04-13.summary: More than 250 films from more than 70 countries will be shown, based at the five screens of St. Anthony Main, across the river from downtown.

2023-04-13.name: Wisconsin Film Festival
2023-04-13.summary: See 150 independent films from Wisconsin and around the world.

2023-04-14.summary: See 150 independent films from Wisconsin and around the world.

2023-04-14.name: Midwest Horse Fair
2023-04-14.summary: There's a Friday-night rodeo, blacksmith championships, stagecoach rides, Texas trick riders, music and performances, including the Wisconsin Mounted Police Team. At Alliant Energy Center.

2023-04-15.name: Dairy State Cheese & Beer Festival
2023-04-15.summary: There's cheese and beer from around the state plus live music at the Brat Stop.

2023-04-28.name: Minnesota Horse Expo
2023-04-28.summary: There's a parade of breeds daily at noon, free horse, pony and carriage rides and a rodeo Friday and Saturday evenings and Sunday afternoon. At the Minnesota State Fairgrounds.

2023-04-28.name: Julien Dubuque Film Festival
2023-04-28.summary: See 70 films and a silent-film showcase. There's a red-carpet awards show Saturday.

2023-04-28.name: Milwaukee Film Festival

2023-04-28.name: Spring Outdoor Adventure Expo
2023-04-28.summary: A spring kickoff for outdoor enthusiasts, with presentations on outdoor adventures and destinations and a gear sale and auction of used canoes and kayaks.

2023-04-28.name: Bluff Country Studio Art Tour
2023-04-28.summary: Take a spring drive through southeast Minnesota and northeast Iowa and visit artists in and around Winona, Lanesboro, Spring Grove and Harmony in Minnesota and Decorah in Iowa.

2023-04-29.name: Taylor County Maple Fest
2023-04-29.summary: This festival at the fairgrounds features maple syrup in a breakfast, a baking contest, a cooking demonstration and crafts plus music,  children's activities and door prizes.

2023-04-30.summary: More than 100 musical acts perform in venues around the Twin Ports, and there also will be film, visual arts and craft beer.
